io.artframework

Interface StorageProvider

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, Scoped
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultMapStorageProvider

    public interface StorageProvider
extends Scoped, java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Use the storage to set and get data for a given Target and/or Context. Use cases for this could be storing a counter or a cooldown timer. Or you could use this to store some global properties that need to be shared. You can store any object that can be serialized into a JSON object. You should try to keep the objects you store simple and primitive values at best. There are also convenience methods on the Context to set and get data. These methods just delegate to the implementing storage provider. 

             // set a global property foo to true
         context.set("foo", true);
         // get the value somewhere later on
         Optional myValue = context.get("foo", Boolean.class);

    • Method Detail

      • of

        static StorageProvider of(Scope scope)

      • set

        default <TValue> java.util.Optional<TValue> set(@Nullable
                                                java.lang.Object module,
                                                @NonNull
                                                @NonNull java.lang.String key,
                                                @NonNull
                                                TValue value)
        Stores value for the module into the persistent metadata store and returns the value that was previously stored. If no value was stored previously and empty optional will be returned.
        Type Parameters:
        TValue - the type of the value
        Parameters:
        module - the module that is used to store the value. can be null.
        key - the key to store the value under
        value - the value to store
        Returns:
        the previously stored value or an empty optional

      • set

        <TValue> java.util.Optional<TValue> set(@NonNull
                                        @NonNull java.lang.String key,
                                        @NonNull
                                        TValue value)
        Stores a value in the persistent metadata store and returns any value that was already stored. If no value was found an empty Optional is returned.
        Type Parameters:
        TValue - type of the value
        Parameters:
        key - The unique key to store a value for.
        value - The value to store.
        Returns:
        existing value if it exists and is of the same type otherwise an empty Optional

      • set

        default <TValue> java.util.Optional<TValue> set(@NonNull
                                                @NonNull Target<?> target,
                                                @NonNull
                                                @NonNull java.lang.String key,
                                                @NonNull
                                                TValue value)
        Stores a value for the given Target. Will override any existing value that has the same key and return that value. Will return an empty Optional if this is the first entry for the given key.
        Type Parameters:
        TValue - type of the value
        Parameters:
        target - target to store value for
        key - storage key
        value - value to store
        Returns:
        an Optional containing the existing value
        See Also:
        set(String, Object)

        Gets a value stored for the given module under the given key.
        Type Parameters:
        TValue - the type of the data
        Parameters:
        module - the module to get data for
        key - the key of the storage
        valueClass - the class of the data
        Returns:
        the stored value or an empty optional

      • get

        <TValue> java.util.Optional<TValue> get(@NonNull
                                        @NonNull java.lang.String key,
                                        @NonNull
                                        @NonNull java.lang.Class<TValue> valueClass)
        Retrieves a stored setting from the store. Will return the default value of the type or an empty Optional if the storage key is not found or the stored value cannot be cast to the needed type.
        Type Parameters:
        TValue - type of the value
        Parameters:
        key - storage key
        valueClass - class of the value
        Returns:
        stored value or empty result if the value does not exist or cannot be cast into the value type.

                                                @NonNull java.lang.Class<TValue> valueClass)
        Retrieves a value stored for the given target. Will return the default value of the type or an empty Optional if the storage key is not found or the stored value cannot be cast to the needed type.
        Type Parameters:
        TValue - type of the value
        Parameters:
        target - target to retrieve value for
        key - storage key
        valueClass - class of the value
        Returns:
        stored value or empty result if the value does not exist or cannot be cast into the value type.
